<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 118, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 194, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 170, 905, 187]]<|/det|>
0625/12  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 194, 905, 210]]<|/det|>
February/March 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 217, 905, 231]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 246, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 437, 293]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 291, 539, 320]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 336, 228, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 353, 880, 522]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.- For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Write in soft pencil.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.- Do not use correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 565, 570, 613]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- Each correct answer will score one mark.- Any rough working should be done on this question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[269, 847, 729, 864]]<|/det|>
This document has 16 pages. Any blank pages are indicated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 653, 90]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a pendulum that oscillates between P and Q.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 100, 609, 272]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 282, 779, 301]]<|/det|>
Which method is used to find the average period of oscillation for the pendulum?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 312, 134, 330]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 311, 541, 330]]<|/det|>
Measure the time it takes to swing from P to Q.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 337, 134, 355]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 336, 870, 355]]<|/det|>
Measure the time it takes to swing from P to Q to P 10 times and divide that time by 10.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 363, 134, 381]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 363, 885, 381]]<|/det|>
Measure the time it takes to swing from P to Q to P 10 times and multiply that time by 10.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 389, 133, 408]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 389, 541, 408]]<|/det|>
Measure the time it takes to swing from Q to P.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 433, 96, 452]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 433, 631, 452]]<|/det|>
A car moves through a measured distance s in a known time \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 463, 761, 483]]<|/det|>
What is the correct equation used to calculate the average speed \(v\) of the car?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 496, 134, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 495, 201, 515]]<|/det|>
\(v = \frac{s}{t}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 496, 300, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 496, 390, 515]]<|/det|>
\(v = s \times t\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 495, 468, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[470, 495, 539, 515]]<|/det|>
\(v = \frac{t}{s}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 497, 636, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 497, 734, 515]]<|/det|>
\(v = s \times t^2\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 553, 96, 571]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 427, 479, 446]]<|/det|>

<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 457, 549, 475]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 483, 361, 501]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 509, 519, 527]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 536, 680, 554]]<|/det|>
